lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Rolling.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This is the main class of the application.
* Running this class will start the application.
private static String line;            // user original input
private static CommandList l1;         // keyword: todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, list, bye
private static int l2;                 // number to mark or unmark: 1, 2, 3, ...
private static String l22;             // Dateformat yyyy-mm-dd
private static String l3;              // contains task description
private static String l4;              // by ? or from ?
hCMD = new HandleCommand(file, todoList, line, lineLength, l1, l2, l22, lineSlashLength, l3, l4, l5);
throw new RollingException(line, lineLength, l1, l2, l22, lineSlashLength, l3, l4, l5, todoList.size());
* The main method of the application.
* Represents a list of commands that the application can execute.
* This class is responsible for managing and executing the commands.
* This class is responsible for executing the commands and managing the results.
private static final Ui ui = new Ui();
public HandleCommand(Storage file, TaskList todoList, String line, int lineLength, CommandList l1, int l2, String l22, int lineSlashLength, String l3, String l4, String l5) {
public static void throwRollingException() throws RollingException {
throw new RollingException(line, lineLength, l1, l2, l22, lineSlashLength, l3, l4, l5, todoList.size());
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
// Check if the date is in the correct format (yyyy-mm-dd)
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
// Check if the date is in the correct format (yyyy-mm-dd)
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
todoList.addTask(file, line, l1, l3, l4, l5);
System.out.println("You have no task in the list now.\n");
* This class is responsible for executing the commands and managing the results.
public RollingException(String line, int lineLength, CommandList l1, int l2, String l22, int lineSlashLength, String l3, String l4, String l5, int listSize) {
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot contain '/'. \nIf you are trying to add a deadline or event, please start with 'deadline' or 'event' instead.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty and should be stated in the format of 'deadline do sth /by ...'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The deadline time can not be empty and should be stated as '/by ...'.\nYou can input deadline time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty, e.g. deadline do sth /by ...\nYou can input deadline time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The deadline must only contain one '/' which is '/by ...'.\nYou can input deadline time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The deadline time cannot be empty.\n");

System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty and should be stated in the format of 'event do sth /from ... /to ...'.\nYou can input event time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The event time is necessary and must have '/from ... /to ...'.\nYou can input event time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty, e.g. event do sth /from ... /to ...\nYou can input event time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The start and end time of the event must only contain two '/' which is '/from ... /to ...'.\nYou can input event time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The start time of the event cannot be empty.\nYou can input event time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The end time of the event cannot be empty.\nYou can input event time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
// Check if the date is in the correct format (yyyy-mm-dd)
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The start time of the event cannot be later than the end time.\n");

System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a period cannot be empty and should be stated in the format of 'period do sth /between ... /and ...'.\nYou can input period time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The period time is necessary and must have '/between ... /and ...'.\nYou can input period time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a period cannot be empty, e.g. period do sth /between ... /and ...\nYou can input period time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The between & and time of the period must only contain two '/' which is '/between ... /and ...'.\nYou can input period time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The start time of the period cannot be empty.\nYou can input period time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The end time of the period cannot be empty.\nYou can input period time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
// Check if the date is in the correct format (yyyy-mm-dd)
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The start time of the period cannot be later than the end time.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please indicate which task you want to " + l1 + ".\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please state in the format of '" + l1 + " ?'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The task to " + l1 + " must be stated as a digit number and larger than 0, e.g. " + l1 + " 1.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! You do not have Task " + l2 + ". \nNow you only have " + listSize + " task(s) in the list.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please indicate which date you want to check.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please state in the format of 'date yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The date format must be 'yyyy-mm-dd'.\n");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please indicate which keyword you want to find.\n");
System.out.println("Please start with a right keyword with space: todo, deadline, event, period, mark, unmark, delete, list, date, find...\n"
